title: Integration Studio—ALM Quality Center integration
content:
Overview

This topic presents an illustrated set of integration use cases between SMAX and Quality Center:

  • Portal-based Defect or Enhancement requests
  • Incident to Defect integration

The use cases in a nutshell:

The integration use cases described in this document serve as examples to inspire and guide your integration efforts. However, they should not be considered as prescriptive or guaranteed solutions for your particular scenario. The examples may or may not be applicable for your license edition.


Use case 1: Portal-based Defect or Enhancement requests

In this sample use case, end users who subscribe to a specific Business Service Application can report defects or request enhancements to the application by posting them via the SMAX Service Portal.
We will follow the steps below, which are performed by Eve, an employee who uses her company’s eExpense application for expense tracking and reporting. She has been frustrated that expense reporting can only be done while logged on to the eExpense web application and wishes that her company would provide an enhancement to enable native mobile access for faster expense reporting. While Eve can post the enhancement request via the Portal, her company is tracking such Application requests in a Quality Center system used by the Application Development team. However, the seamless integration with the Portal makes this internal detail transparent from Eve.

Step 1: Portal access

Eve logs on to the Service Portal where she knows she can have access to a variety of self-service support features, such as catalog, knowledge, and subscription management for the applications she uses every day.

Step 2:  Submitting an enhancement request or defect

Eve proceeds to get help from the Portal Virtual Agent, specifying that she would like to request an enhancement for eExpense. 

A second option is to raise an application defect or enhancement request is by leveraging her subscription. Below we see Eve consulting her list of Services & Assets where she can see her subscription to the eExpense application service listed.

She proceeds to drill down into the details of the application subscriptions and finds a list of requests she can make against the eExpense application. She selects the link to report an enhancement against the service. She could also use this method to raise a defect in case she needs to.

Another option is that Eve browses through the application category to find the offering to submit an enhancement request. 
In either case, the systems assist by providing her with a dedicated request form designed for the application service to either request an enhancement or report a defect.


Step 3: Quality Center Feature created and confirmation provided back to the user

So far Eve has engaged purely via the Self-Service Portal. However, as soon as her request is submitted, a behind-the-scenes automation flow creates the necessary record in Quality Center. Below is a screen showing an Quality Center Requirement record that has been created to track the request. Since Eve indicated that the issue type is "Improvement", the Quality Center record created has been appropriately tagged according to Quality Center’s types that can be used to track the development backlog.

Step 4: Status confirmation

While the record above is created behind the scenes, the Portal provides validation and confirmation back to Eve, letting her know that an enhancement record has been logged for review by the application development team. An enhancement ticket ID from Quality Center is even provided back to Eve so that she can use it for future reference.

Step 5: Behind the scenes - association of the Quality Center ticket from the SMAX Request ticket

While at this point the ownership of the enhancement has been passed over, we should also note that details of the association between the Quality Center Feature and Eve’s Portal request have been logged. In reviewing the Request record, SMAX Service Desk agents can find a direct reference to the related Quality Center Requirement that's tracking the potential work to enhance the application.
The screen below shows details about Quality Center’s response in the creation of its Requirement record as they are recorded in the Request’s Offering section. Note some specific fields of interest, such as:

  • Remote ID: The Quality Center ID that's tracking the enhancement
  • Remote status: The status of the Quality Center record (at that point in time)
  • Remote system: The name of the system to integrate with

The creation of a defect in Quality Center can happen in the same way as raising an enhancement request. Select the “Report a defect” offering in the portal. The main difference is, the Enhancement request gets automatically resolved, but the defect stays open for analysis and troubleshooting by the helpdesk to answer questions from the application management team working with Quality Center.

Use case 2: Change request to requirement

This use case describes how to create a new feature in Quality Center based on a Change request in Service Management. Within a change record, the change owner might want to create a new requirement in Quality Center. To do so, the change owner can click the button Create Requirement. The system will then create a new requirement in Quality Center to track the details and put the details as external reference into the change record.

Use case 3: Incident/Request/Problem to defect

In this use case, Stephen reviews the Incident where a user reports an application malfunction. After analysis, Stephen confirms that the issue is an application defect, which needs to be fixed by the application team. 

Stephen assigns the ticket to the RnD group and enters a comment to the record. The assignment of the Incident triggers the execution of an integration, which creates a new defect in Quality Center.

Note Incidents are used in this example. However, the defect creation into Quality Center can be triggered from Requests, Incidents, Problems, and Changes in Service Management. Triggering the integration from Studio apps requires some small changes to the integrations.

Tip: You can also create a new feature request in Quality Center in a similar way.


After he clicks ADD & SAVE RECORD, the defect is created in the Quality Center system. Within the Incident in Service Management, we track the following data from the Quality Center record.

  • Remote ID: The Quality Center ID that's tracking the Defect
  • Remote status: The status of the Quality Center record (at that point in time)

The Incident details as well as the comments are transferred to the Quality Center system.

Use case 4: Get status update

To get the latest status from Quality Center reflected in Service Management, a button Pull ALM Update can be made available. Clicking the button will pull the status from Quality Center and update the record in Service Management.

Let's change the status in the Quality Center defect we just raised:


Clicking the button in Service Management will show the new Quality Center status in the SMAX record.

In addition, a comment is added to the Discussions section.

Set up the integration

As an example, the procedure below will set up the integration to implement the Incident Exchange use case.

Prepare an integration user

Perform the following steps to prepare an integration user:

  1. Create an integration user. See How to create an integration user.

  2. Log in to the Agent Portal as the tenant admin, and do the following:

    • Navigate to Administration > Master Data > People, locate the integration user, and assign the proper roles to access the required modules. Example: Incident Manager, Incident Analyst, and Incident Coordinator. The user must also have a role with the On-Premise Bridge/Integration Administrator permission. 

      Alternatively, assign the Tenant Admin role to grant general access.

    • (If not Tenant Admin) Navigate to Administration > Master Data > People > Roles, and create a new role with Create, View, and Update permissions for the External reference and External system record types.


Export the certificate from the Quality Center instance

To connect to Quality Center, you will need to upload their root CA certificate in a later step. To get the certificate from Quality Center, you can export the certificate from the browser as base64 encoded to a file.

Configure SMAX

Create an endpoint

Create an endpoint using the Rest Executor 2.0 endpoint type:

  1. Log in to the Agent Portal as the tenant admin.
  2. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Endpoints.
  3. Click Add.
  4. Select Rest Executor 2.0 as the endpoint type, enter a name for the endpoint (for example, Quality Center), and then click Add. The system creates the endpoint.
  5. Click Configure and complete the fields depending on whether the endpoint needs to use the OPB Agent.  

If the endpoint doesn't need to use the OPB Agent, complete these fields.

Example:

Create an integration

Create an integration and configure one or more scenarios to define the business logic for forwarding tickets and synchronizing ticket updates to Quality Center. The Quality Center connector has three predefined scenario templates: 

  • Enhancement tracking 
  • Defect tracking
  • Pull status updates

In the following steps, you'll create an integration with these predefined templates.

  1. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Integration Studio. 
  2. Click New, enter the name of your integration, and then click Save. The system displays the Integration page.
  3. In the Details section, configure the integration user you created for the current Service Management system and activate the integration.
  4. In the Connector-Endpoint mappings section, click Add to add a mapping.
  5. Select Quality Center (under OpenText) as the connector, select the Quality Center endpoint that you created earlier, and then enter an alias for the mapping.
  6. Click Save.

Configure the scenarios

Perform the following steps to add the scenarios to the integration:

  1. Click Add scenario. 
  2. Enter a name for the scenario. For example, Enhancement tracking.
  3. In the Template field, select Enhancement tracking (under OpenText Quality Center) from the list. 
  4. Click Save to add the scenario. 
  5. (Optional) Repeat the steps above to add the rest of the scenarios listed in the table below.
Note Using templates will make the integration configuration easier than starting from scratch. If you don't select this option, you'll have to manually add your own logic, starting from a blank page.

Use the scenarios

Use case 1 – Portal-based Defect or Enhancement requests

Having set up the endpoint and the integration, the final step is about the business logic to trigger the integration. To see this use case working, a Catalog Offering with a Fulfillment Task Plan that invokes the appropriate Quality Center integration is needed.

As you may recall, in the Use Case example, Eve submitted an Improvement Request via an Offering associated with the eExpense application:

In the newly created Offering:

  • We have designated Applications as a related Service Definition.
  • We have also set Subscription as the value for the Required asset information. This means that users submitting the Defect or Enhancement request for eExpense must have specified the Subscription to the Application service that they have been granted.

Specify user options

Specific user options will be added to collect information from the user as well as to store results provided back by Quality Center during its creation of an issue record. You can find the following options in the screens below:

User option name

Label

VisibilityDescription
Title_c
 		Provide a short titleUserA portal facing option used to collect the user's issue title
Description_cProvide a detailed descriptionUserA portal facing option used to collect the user's issue description
Success_cRecord created?AgentIndicates whether the record was successfully created in the ALM system.


Define a task plan

In this step, create a task plan that triggers the Quality Center integration. The full task plan will include a few automated tasks as shown below:

  1. The first task creates the Quality Center Issue. 

  2. A condition task then checks whether the Quality Center Issue was successfully created.

    • If it's a success, the subsequent tasks proceed to add a comment with results for the user and to mark the Request as fulfilled.
    • If it's a failure, a manual task is created which needs to be handled. The request stays in fulfilment queue for manual intervention.


Task 1 – Create Enhancement in ALM System:

  1. Add an Automated Task.
  2. Give the task a title, description and assignment group.
  3. Select Call Integration Studio as the Business Rule for the Task.
  4. Select integration Quality Center and scenario Enhancement tracking.
  5. Save the task.

Decision details:

  1. Add a decision to the task plan.
  2. Enter a title.
  3. Enter following condition: ${entity.UserOptions.Success_c}.
  4. Enter Yes and No as output value.
  5. Save the task.

This decision waits that the Integration Studio updates the "Success" user option in the request with the integration result. The Integration Studio will set "Yes" in case of success or "No" in case of failure.

Task 2: Resolve Request

  1. Add an Automated Task.
  2. Give the task a title, description and assignment group.
  3. Select Set fields as the Business Rule for the Task.
  4. Enter a solution and a completion code.
  5. Save the task.

Task 3: Manually manage the request

  1. Add a manual Task.
  2. Give the task a title, description and assignment group.
  3. Save the task.

Define default value

In the default values section, define the values as required, but you must set at least a Service Desk group, a Service, and a Category to automatically move the request into the Initial Support phase, which then triggers the integration defined in the task plan.

In addition, set the "Record created?" user option to "pending response" since the Integration Studio is checking this initial value.

Save the offering.

Repeat the same steps for "Report a defect offering". The only difference is to select the Defect tracking scenario in the first task in the task plan and not add task 2 to automatically resolve the request.


To send additional comments from SMAX to Quality Center, add the following business rule to the Request entity in Studio.

The condition in this example is:
${current_update.Comments.IsChanged && current_user.Upn != 'intJan' && lookup('ExternalReference','RemoteSystem','EntityType','Request','EntityId',entity.Id,'RemoteSystem','Quality Center')=='Quality Center'}
This means when:

  • a comment is added 
  • and the update is not coming from the integration user configured in the Integration Studio
  • and there is a Quality Center record in the ExternalReference entity

then the integration is triggered, and comments are sent to Quality Center.

To create a new Requirement in Quality Center when the button is clicked in the change request, perform the following steps.

  1. Go to Studio and select the entity “change”.

  2. Go to custom actions and add your custom action, make sure that you select the “Enable Workflow” checkbox.

Use case 3 – Incident/Request/Problem to defect

To create defects directly from an incident, request, or problem, perform the following steps.

As the integration and endpoints are now set up, all you need to do is to create a business rule that triggers the integration based on your needs.

To do this, go to your studio entity > Processes and Rules > After applying changes, and then add a new "Call Integration Studio" business rule.


The condition in this example is:

${entity.ExpertGroup.Name=='RnD' && (current_update.ExpertGroup.IsChanged || current_update.Comments.IsChanged) && current_user.Upn != '<UPN of the integration user>'}

This means that the integration is triggered when:

  • the Incident is assigned to the RnD group as expert group
  • or a comment is added 
  • and the update is not coming from the integration user configured in the Integration Studio

You can add a similar business rule with your condition to trigger this integration.

It is also possible to create enhancement requests via this method.
